Daryl’s cabin is set on river way that opens to a lake. The water levels might change the experience some during the summer, but still enjoyable I imagine. As a marker for us, Yazoo River was at 22.1 ft @ Greenwood. We were able to navigate a 18ft canoe down river for a couple of miles with more to be had. If you are any kind of fisherman, this will be a delight. The river is bordered by cypress trees adding to the scenic views. I should note we saw no one else on the water while we were there, which was nice for us. The cabin gives you great access to the water with a small boat landing.
As for the cabin, it was cozy. We brought much of our own stuff, but it seemed well-equipped to hand most any kitchen or leisure tasks. If you are here for the ‘country escape’ or the fishing/water, you’ll be in heaven.
We took our dogs and placed a kennel on the back porch. They had a ball.
We took a bike ride down the county road one morning, which was fun.
The phone coverage is very iffy, but that was nice too. We did not need much, but daryl was very responsive and checked on us one day (I see that as a nice gesture since the cell phone coverage is iffy).
We plan to come back as I hone my fishing skills. :-)
If you are looking for a chill place that offers fishing or kayaking on a peaceful lake/river and don’t mine getting a little dirty at times, book this place. It’s obviously a piece of Daryl, and Daryl is a nice guy that’s down to Earth.
Thx,
Casey and Jay
